pros: • Excellent communication • Caring and Supportive Supervisors • Flexibility and equal distribution of work • Access to the latest technology to provide the highest standard of services • Great compensation and benefits
cons: Some days can be super busy.

review_title: Unethical Medical Management at Hospital: Disregard for Patient's Well-Being
pros: I have never worked for a company that paid so generously. The compensation and benefits package were excellent and made a significant impact in my life.
cons: During my time at this hospital, I have unfortunately come to the realization that the doctors in charge of the medical care were not only unprofessional but also unethical. Their disregard for the well-being of their patients was truly disheartening and made it evident that they had regard for the Hippocratic Oath. Attempting to voice my concerns to the hospital administration proved to e a futile effort, as they seemed more preoccupied with protecting the reputation of the hospital than addressing the bothersome behavior of their staff. It's a shame to say that some of my favorites among the doctors I worked with turned out to be the worst offenders in terms of their unethical practices.

review_title: Expect to be abused and exploited by the managers
pros: You aren't forced to work in this horrible place
cons: If you decided to join this company, expect to be abused and exploited by the managers. The management is very greedy, and its main goal is to exploit as much as labor as possible from the employees. The work environment is terribly lackluster because the leadership does not do anything for the employees at all.

review_title: In-service Education, Personal & Professional Growth Opportunities
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Opelousas, LA
pros:
OGH is an established institution with over 60 years’ presence in the healthcare industry. Despite its long history, OGH has been able to retain its family feel. Environment is caring as one would expect but not only for patients but for employees as well. Here, I’m proud to work with professional colleagues and I feel more than happy everytime we discharge fully recovered patients. 
Here are the employee benefits we get to enjoy here at OGH: 
+ Cafeteria & Pharmacy Discounts
+ Extended Illness Benefit
+ Paid Time Off
+ Dental / Health / Vision Insurance
+ Group Disability / Life Insurance
+ Liability Coverage
+ Medical Home
+ Medicare
+ Retirement Contribution
+ Shift Differentials
+ Tax-Deferred Annuity
cons: 12-hour shifts and busy days – but that is the nurse’s life.

review_title: Great place to work with a family atmosphere!
pros: Opelousas General has been a great place to work for the last 12 years.  We have a great family friendly atmosphere where people make you feel like part of the family.  Everyone is so friendly and caring.
cons: Steadily growing so very busy - but I like to be busy!

review_title: Not Bitter or Hostile......Very Disappointed with Employment Experience
pros: Good health insurance and retirement benefit package.
cons:
These are the 10 reasons I believe OGHS is absolutely not an ideal place to work.  These reasons are not opinions; these are things I witnessed and experienced.

1)  The number 1 'con' about being employed with this organization is VERY low compensation with MINIMAL merit increases.

2)  Limited recognition and compensation for high performers.  High performers receive the same merit percentage as low performers; no incentive for doing an exceptional job.

3)  Tenure is valued over employees' actual contribution and productivity.  Some tenured employees' unacceptable behavior and low productivity are overlooked and permitted by some mid-level and senior managers.

4)  Process inefficiencies are tolerated by some mid level and senior managers.  Some employees and managers are reluctant to change.  "This is how we've always done it" plagues this organization.  

5) Lack of support from senior management for mid-level managers and front line supervisors.  Lack of support ranging from training and education to corrective action for direct reports.

6) "Lead By Example" is rarely practiced by senior managers.  "Do What I Say and Not What I Do" should be senior managers' motto.

7) 95% of employees do not embrace and practice the organization's Service Standards of Behavior.  Every candidate for a position at OGHS is introduced to these awesome standards BUT rarely demonstrate on a daily basis.  The 5% of employees that do embrace and practice OGHS' Standards of Behavior are usually discouraged, disappointed and/or disgusted with the lack of consistency.

8)  Rude and obnoxious behavior from front line employees and senior management is sadly tolerated and often times is overlooked.  

9)  Some managers prefer to 'pacify' employees as opposed to help employees grow as professionals.  

10)  There are several employees in managerial positions with minimal management skills and minimal education.  This is a prime example of how the organization values tenure over actual skill and contribution.  Also, there are some employees in managerial positions with proper education but severe lack of leadership and management skills.  There is no balance...employees who report to these managers are suffering.

pros: Opelousas General has really god physicians in all areas. If you are a nurse or technician the only area I recommend to work is Labor and delivery. Most of the other departments are ran by incompetent supervisors that have been there forever and do absolutely nothing all day.
cons: Low pay. Incompetent and lazy employees. Supervisors who only gossip. Always drama!stay away! The good employees are bullied and taken advantage of

pros: Staff coworkers are like family, my immediate dept. supervisors very good in assisting with time off.  Enjoy working with mid level providers
cons: Heavy patient loads, raises limited  to 2% on annual reviews, re: insurance-very small group of providers on tier 1 level health insurance, specialists needed out side this small group become a very expensive out of pocket

cons: There are no cons...it is an open, inviting place to work
